clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Knee Arthrosis After Bariatric Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Knee Arthrosis in Severely Obese Patients After Bariatric Surgery.

brief_summary.textblock:
Impact of loss of weight on knee arthrosis has not been thoroughly studied. The primary goal of this study is to compare the MRI parameters (aspect of cartilage and oedema of spongious sub-chondral bone) before and one year after bariatric surgery.
Knee MRI is not currently part of the investigations preceding bariatric surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
Assessment of knee arthrosis in severely obese patients after bariatric surgery.
Impact of loss of weight on knee arthrosis has not been thoroughly studied. The primary goal of this study is to compare the MRI parameters (aspect of cartilage and oedema of spongious sub-chondral bone) before and one year after bariatric surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: variation of knee joint space thickness
primary_outcome.description: Joint space variation in percentages (mean joint space variation calculated for each patient group). Mean joint space comparison between 2 groups of obese patients: patients with Bypass surgery versus patients without surgery.
proportion of patients with Pain Scores on the Visual Analog Scale ≥ 30/100 (for at least one knee). Comparison at one year after bariatric surgery versus inclusion.

secondary_outcome.description: Pain Scores on the Visual Analog Scale >= 3 and/or radiological signs of atherosis
mean Pain Scores on the Visual Analog Scale and mean value of KOOS index for knee function.

secondary_outcome.measure: evolution of KOOS score after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Among the 80 patients undergoing surgery, comparison of KOOS function score before surgery versus 6 months, 1 year and two years after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: evolution of pain scores after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Among the 80 patients undergoing surgery, comparison of mean Pain Scores on the Visual Analog Scale before surgery versus 6 months, 1 year and two years after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: evolution of the proportion of patients in pain
secondary_outcome.description: Among the 80 patients undergoing surgery, comparison of the proportion of patients with Pain Scores on the Visual Analog Scale ≥ 30/100 before surgery versus 6 months, 1 year and two years after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: evolution of knee MRI parameters after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Among the 80 patients undergoing surgery, comparison of the MRI parameters (T2, cartilage volume, œdema of sub-chondral spongious bone) before surgery versus 6 months, 1 year and two years after surgery.

arm_group.description: knee MRI for all patients undergoing bariatric surgery as usual care

intervention.description: knee MRI before surgery (inclusion) and one year after

study_pop.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- bariatric surgery
- IMC >= 35
Exclusion Criteria:
- those of bariatric surgery
- contra-indication to MRI
- pregnancy
